body_html: @zffchen78 ,does y_grad_node_outputs mean the gradient of y_node_outputs? To be clear, think the function y = 3 * x. Now i konw the node y, x and dy, and i want to compute the dx. The source code just put dy in x's backpropedGradient and i think it is wrong.
body_text: @zffchen78 ,does y_grad_node_outputs mean the gradient of y_node_outputs? To be clear, think the function y = 3 * x. Now i konw the node y, x and dy, and i want to compute the dx. The source code just put dy in x's backpropedGradient and i think it is wrong.
body: @zffchen78 ,does y_grad_node_outputs mean the gradient of y_node_outputs? To be clear, think the function y = 3 \* x. Now i konw the node y, x and dy, and i want to compute the dx. The source code just put dy in x's backpropedGradient and i think it is wrong.
